body.name: Side Post Car Battery Disconnect Switch，Car Battery Terminal Link Quick Switch，Battery Master Switch Isolator for Power Disconnect Cut Off (with Long Bolt)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 8 hrs 33 mins
features: [Built-in details] There is a side Post battery switch and long bolt in the package.
[Compatible] The screw hole diameter is 10mm, the rated current is 100A, and the instantaneous current is 300A.

[Easy to use] The side column battery cut-off switch is installed on the negative terminal of the battery and fixed with screws. The switch is a knob type, and the knob is marked with on and off. Turn the knob to cut off and connect the power battery.
[Durable material] The side-post battery cut-off switch is made of solid brass, which is rust-proof, corrosion-resistant, durable, superior in performance and good in conductivity.

[No battery power consumption] This battery isolation switch can quickly cut off the battery power. When the vehicle is parked for a long time, the knob can be turned to the off position to eliminate battery power consumption and increase battery life.
body.description: The side column battery cut-off switch is installed on the negative terminal of the battery and fixed with screws. The switch is a knob type, and the knob is marked with on and off. Turn the knob to cut off and connect the power battery.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simple solution to a lot of battery current leakage problems.
reviews.reviewText: As a car ages there are electronic systems and circuits that start to develop small leakage currents.Often the cost to find and replace these leaking circuits that are fully operational - can cost more that the vehicle can be sold for.This switch turns of all these battery drains and when the car is in use the charging system generally is not impacted by these little current thieves.Important Note: On side mount lead acid batteries you have about a half inch of 3/8" by 16 thread in the soft lead terminals.you will need to engage all the threads just as deep as the battery cable does so the threads do not get stripped out.My solution to get full bolt engagement and bottoming the bolt completely without putting the stress on the threads when tightening a bolt that may be a little too long or too short when fully tightened.I Bought a much longer (3/8") by 16 thread (4" or 5")Bolt. Thread a nut on this bolt and then put on a lock washer leaving about 3" of bolt thread to go through the unthreaded bolt hole of the cut off switch. Then finger tighten this bolt into the battery terminal making sure you have full thread engagement and a solid bottom stop.Now you can tighten the nut to fully compress the lock washer and know that the battery switch is secure.The cable position should have been established before the switch is fully tightened.I had to first remove the plastic battery cover to get the new battery switch to fit flat and mate correctly with the battery terminal ( I used the negative terminal as it was the most accessible).Good Luck.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
